overall_summary: Discussion centered on the confirmed February/March 2026 Korean exchange delistings tied to the AI16Z→ElizaOS rebrand/swap transparency, alongside ongoing token migration eligibility/LP errors and unanswered questions about token utility. In parallel, engineering activity focused on resolving ElizaOS v1.7.0 Discord/serverId compatibility issues and improving core/client transports and plugin-sql security/serverless support.
key_facts: Bithumb, Coinone, and Korbit announced termination of trading support for AI16Z and ElizaOS, with trading ending on 2026-02-12 and deposits/withdrawals ending on 2026-03-12, citing DAXA concerns about transparency and disclosure around the rebranding/token swap process.

Users reported AI16Z→ElizaOS migration problems including LP-related "max amount reached" errors and cases where wallets showed 0 eligible tokens, and helpers redirected users to migration support/ticket channels.
Community members stated that AI16Z purchases made after the 2025-11-11 snapshot are not eligible for migration.
For ElizaCloud container deployments, community guidance stated that either PGlite or PostgreSQL can be used.

A recurring ElizaOS v1.7.0 Discord integration failure produced "No server ID found" errors attributed to the serverId→messageServerId migration and incompatibility with plugin-discord v1.3.3, with mitigation advice to downgrade to core v1.6.5 or test a fix branch.
PR #6333 (odilitime) was merged into elizaos/eliza on 2026-01-07 to update plugin-bootstrap (and a plugin-sql schema comment) for the serverId→messageServerId change.
PR #6300 (standujar) was merged into elizaos/eliza on 2026-01-05 introducing unified client hooks (useElizaChat) supporting HTTP/SSE/WebSocket transports and aligning server transport parameters.

PR #6343 (standujar) was opened on 2026-01-08 to add Neon serverless support and improve RLS security in plugin-sql, including switching RLS context setting to parameterized set_config calls and renaming withEntityContext to withIsolationContext.
Discord guidance for resolving ElizaOS Cloud agent API "Model not found" errors stated that the model parameter must include a provider prefix (e.g., openai/gpt-4o-mini).
Bazaar was described in Discord as a decentralized marketplace application running on Jeju, characterized as an "appstore for agents."
open_questions: When is elizaOS token going to get some usecase as utility within the ecosystem, why is it not being used for payments?
Can I use Eliza for X without paying for X API ($200/month)?
Does the Bithumb/Coinone delisting mean elizaOS will be listed after ai16z delisting in February?
Are these guys (KamiyoAI) using the elizaos plugin?
Does the KamiyoAI project make sense?

new_issues_prs.title: feat(plugin-sql): add Neon serverless support & improve RLS security
new_issues_prs.author: standujar
new_issues_prs.significance: Adds Neon serverless DB support and hardens RLS context setting with parameterized queries; includes API rename to withIsolationContext.

new_issues_prs.title: fix: plugin-bootstrap (+ sql minor) actions/providers for serverId => messageServerId change
new_issues_prs.author: odilitime
new_issues_prs.significance: Aligns plugin-bootstrap with serverId→messageServerId migration to address reported Discord compatibility issues.

new_issues_prs.title: feat: unified hooks with multi-transport support (HTTP/SSE/WebSocket)
new_issues_prs.author: standujar
new_issues_prs.significance: Introduces useElizaChat and transport alignment across client/server, with tests and a fix for double/triple message processing.

new_issues_prs.title: P1 publishing failure preventing plugin-discord v1.3.4 release
new_issues_prs.author: unknown
new_issues_prs.significance: Blocks shipping a new Discord plugin release.

new_issues_prs.title: Telegram plugin crashes when processing certain images (TypeError on photos)
new_issues_prs.author: unknown
new_issues_prs.significance: Identifies a crash condition in plugin-telegram image handling.

new_issues_prs.title: feat(plugin-sql): add CachedDatabaseAdapter with LRU caching and serverless optimization
new_issues_prs.author: 0xbbjoker
new_issues_prs.significance: Proposes a caching layer for DB adapter reads plus runtime embedding-dimension caching to reduce repeated calls; marked DO NOT MERGE.

new_issues_prs.title: fix(plugin-sql): use sql.raw() for SET LOCAL to avoid parameterization errors
new_issues_prs.author: 0xbbjoker
new_issues_prs.significance: Fixes SQL execution failures when data isolation is enabled due to SET LOCAL parameterization.

new_issues_prs.title: Create guide for agent memory configuration
new_issues_prs.author: unknown
new_issues_prs.significance: Documentation gap raised from community discussion (agent memory).

overall_focus.claim: GitHub activity emphasized platform stability and DX: fixing plugin-sql crashes, aligning Discord/plugin APIs, expanding docs coverage, and unifying client transports via useElizaChat.

discord_updates.summary: Users discussed AI16Z→ElizaOS migration failures (including LP "max amount reached"), conflicting guidance about whether exchanges auto-migrate balances, and the confirmed Korean exchange delistings tied to rebrand/swap transparency concerns. Token utility questions (payments/gas) remained unanswered, and scammer outreach around migration required moderation.

Technical discussion covered Eliza’s data foundation and context graphs, Jeju/Bazaar positioning, and deployment options (PGlite vs PostgreSQL). Multiple data-collection proposals were shared (phone app for user-contributed training data; IOU-based incentive mechanisms; motion-capture data capture).

Core-devs discussed integrating high-quality daily/weekly/monthly agentic workflow insights into last-mile applications (agents, webhooks, apps) and noted that inference markets have not been highly profitable based on platform/OpenRouter observations.

Engineering triage focused on ElizaOS v1.7.0 Discord breakage from serverId→messageServerId migration, with recommendations to downgrade to v1.6.5 or use a fix branch while testing compatibility with plugin-discord v1.3.3.

user_feedback.feedback_summary: Users asked for a clear, documented ElizaOS token utility roadmap (payments/gas/other in-ecosystem uses).
Multiple migration UX issues were reported (0 eligible tokens; LP migration "max amount reached"), with requests for clearer guidance and resolution paths.
ElizaCloud documentation was reported as down (elizacloud.ai/docs).
Users asked for an alternative to the $200/month X API requirement for X integration or a scraping approach through Eliza.
Community members requested improved discoverability of the official contract address across official channels (e.g., X/Twitter accounts and linktree).

strategic_insights.theme: Korean exchange delisting drives urgent communications requirements
strategic_insights.insight: Korean exchanges scheduled the removal of AI16Z/ElizaOS trading and later deposits/withdrawals while citing rebrand/swap transparency, and Discord users expressed confusion about auto-migration on exchanges. A single authoritative migration and exchange-handling statement could reduce conflicting community guidance.
implications_or_questions: Is there an official exchange-by-exchange migration policy statement that can be published and pinned?
What disclosure artifacts (timeline, snapshot rules, swap mechanics) can be made explicit to address transparency concerns?

strategic_insights.theme: Versioning and compatibility management between core and plugins
strategic_insights.insight: Discord integration failures tied to the serverId→messageServerId migration, plus the need to test plugin-discord compatibility across branches, show that core/plugin release coordination affects user-facing reliability. Merged fixes (e.g., #6333) and pending release blockers in plugin-discord reinforce the need for clear compatibility matrices and release automation health.
implications_or_questions: Should releases include a published compatibility table (core version ↔ plugin versions)?
Is the plugin-discord publishing pipeline issue (#40) the highest operational blocker for Discord stability?

strategic_insights.theme: Data products need last-mile integration surfaces
strategic_insights.insight: Core-dev discussion emphasized that agentic workflows already generate high-quality daily/weekly/monthly insights, but delivery into agents/webhooks/apps remains a gap. Prioritizing integration endpoints and reference apps could convert internal insights into user-visible value.
implications_or_questions: Which integration surface (webhooks vs in-product UI vs agent API) is the fastest path to shipping these insights?

market_analysis.observation: Korean exchanges scheduled delisting dates for AI16Z/ElizaOS with stated transparency/disclosure concerns around rebranding/token swap.
market_analysis.relevance: Direct impact on trading venues and user ability to deposit/withdraw in the Korean market during the specified timelines.

market_analysis.observation: Agent Joshua stated that inference markets have not been highly profitable based on observations from models offered on their platform and OpenRouter over the past year.
market_analysis.relevance: Informs prioritization decisions for revenue models and product strategy around inference marketplaces.
